channel.title: maryanne hobbs / @maryannehobbs
channel.description: Twitter feed for: @maryannehobbs. Generated by nitter.42l.fr

item.title: #45 how do you write an NME cover story? notes laid all over the bedroom floor.. at 3am, i’d take the long road out to the margins of consciousness.. stand alone in the fog in this liminal space.. waiting for words that would carry me like a wild horse..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #45 how do you write an NME cover story? notes laid all over the bedroom floor.. at 3am, i’d take the long road out to the margins of consciousness.. stand alone in the fog in this liminal space.. waiting for words that would carry me like a wild horse..

item.title: #44 when i returned to London from my shed in Hollywood (ref #24) the Features Editor at NME called me and said, ‘We know a lot about The Smiths and Marxist politics, but we don’t know enough about hard rock music.. you better come and write for us.’
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #44 when i returned to London from my shed in Hollywood (ref #24) the Features Editor at NME called me and said, ‘We know a lot about The Smiths and Marxist politics, but we don’t know enough about hard rock music.. you better come and write for us.’

item.title: #43 in the 80s and early 90s, the pages of NME were dirty with the fury of youth.. deadlines were brutal.. wages, pitiful.. we fought about everything, from which Artist to anoint on the cover, to the fatuous use of an exclamation mark.. serious business.. we loved* it..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #43 in the 80s and early 90s, the pages of NME were dirty with the fury of youth.. deadlines were brutal.. wages, pitiful.. we fought about everything, from which Artist to anoint on the cover, to the fatuous use of an exclamation mark.. serious business.. we loved* it..

item.title: #42 Lesson Jenny Holzer - YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR CONSTITUTING THE MEANING OF THINGS
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description:
#42 Lesson
Jenny Holzer - YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR CONSTITUTING THE MEANING OF THINGS

item.title: #41 i wanted to be the girl that rides the motorcycle.. not the pillion passenger.. i taught myself, the hard way, kissing the tarmac once or twice.. passed my test at 17 on a 125 Yahama.. blood red, straight bars, spoke wheels.. a siren..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #41 i wanted to be the girl that rides the motorcycle.. not the pillion passenger.. i taught myself, the hard way, kissing the tarmac once or twice.. passed my test at 17 on a 125 Yahama.. blood red, straight bars, spoke wheels.. a siren..

item.title: #40 i’d hook-up with the fast boys at the Market Cross.. we’d ride to Silverstone to see the gladiatorial battles of Barry Sheene and Kenny Roberts.. and they’d mainline the M6 for 200 miles.. it was almost the only circumstances in which i’d ride pillion..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #40 i’d hook-up with the fast boys at the Market Cross.. we’d ride to Silverstone to see the gladiatorial battles of Barry Sheene and Kenny Roberts.. and they’d mainline the M6 for 200 miles.. it was almost the only circumstances in which i’d ride pillion..

item.title: #39 there was only ever one iconic pillion rider.. The Golden Youth in Mad Max 2..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #39 there was only ever one iconic pillion rider.. The Golden Youth in Mad Max 2..

item.title: #38 the Biker gangs would often ride together.. the quickest boys flew first.. they’d tear down the reeling rural lanes.. we’d chase the trail of burning two-stroke.. negotiating every bend, pothole, camber and cattle grid with absolute precision.. riding was a high magic..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #38 the Biker gangs would often ride together.. the quickest boys flew first.. they’d tear down the reeling rural lanes.. we’d chase the trail of burning two-stroke.. negotiating every bend, pothole, camber and cattle grid with absolute precision.. riding was a high magic..

item.title: #37 there were clear lines distinguishing the two key Biker groups.. - long-haired, oil-soaked, smelt of patchouli and No.6.. - clean, quick-witted, highly competitive, they loved to turn a steep hilltop road into their own night time race track..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description:
#37 there were clear lines distinguishing the two key Biker groups..
- long-haired, oil-soaked, smelt of patchouli and No.6..
- clean, quick-witted, highly competitive, they loved to turn a steep hilltop road into their own night time race track..

item.title: #36 at 15, i started hanging around between different Biker gangs.. it’s a space i have found myself in most of my life.. not quite belonging.. always moving..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description:
#36 at 15, i started hanging around between different Biker gangs..
it’s a space i have found myself in most of my life.. not quite belonging.. always moving..

item.title:
#35 Lesson Peter Saville – distil
(first gig: David Bowie, Free Trade Hall, Manchester (1969) supporting Blind Faith)
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description:
#35 Lesson

item.title: #34 David Bowie wore his flaws like a set of flamboyant hats..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #34 David Bowie wore his flaws like a set of flamboyant hats..

item.title: # 33 when i first met David Bowie, i played him recordings of 50th birthday messages.. when Bowie heard the voice of Scott Walker, thanking him for freeing so many Artists.. he fell silent and tears began to pool in his eyes.. finally, he said: "I think see God in the window.."
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: # 33 when i first met David Bowie, i played him recordings of 50th birthday messages.. when Bowie heard the voice of Scott Walker, thanking him for freeing so many Artists.. he fell silent and tears began to pool in his eyes.. finally, he said: "I think see God in the window.."

item.title: #32 Ryuichi Sakamoto told me when he first met David Bowie in the 70s, he was astonished at just how advanced Bowie’s thinking was.. he described Tokyo as a ‘cybernetic city’
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #32 Ryuichi Sakamoto told me when he first met David Bowie in the 70s, he was astonished at just how advanced Bowie’s thinking was.. he described Tokyo as a ‘cybernetic city’

item.title: #31 David Bowie smelt of Issey Miyake
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #31 David Bowie smelt of Issey Miyake

item.title: #30 Lavinia Greenlaw captured David Bowie beautifully in her poem ‘Where are we now?’ written on the day he left us.. ‘.. in order to be heard I must not repeat myself. Nor must I depend on anyone listening.’
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description:
#30 Lavinia Greenlaw captured David Bowie beautifully in her poem ‘Where are we now?’ written on the day he left us..
‘.. in order to be heard I must not repeat myself.
Nor must I depend on anyone listening.’

item.title: #29 when i was 13, i believed that if i could decode the lyrics of ‘Subterraneans’ i’d find the keys to the gate.. it didn’t happen.. but what David Bowie actually taught me was.. ‘the answer’ is not the answer.. live inside the mystery.. keep seeking..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description: #29 when i was 13, i believed that if i could decode the lyrics of ‘Subterraneans’ i’d find the keys to the gate.. it didn’t happen.. but what David Bowie actually taught me was.. ‘the answer’ is not the answer.. live inside the mystery.. keep seeking..

item.title: #28 Lesson SHERELLE - Beautiful project imagine the world you want to live in, and begin to build it..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description:
#28 Lesson
SHERELLE - Beautiful project
imagine the world you want to live in, and begin to build it..

item.title: #27 the Firefly on Hollywood & Vine.. beloved of bikers, hustlers, dealers, the odd actor & thrash metal band.. i'd take a seat at the bar and play dice with the night.. a narrow steel trough ran around bar's edge and at midnight, they’d fill with fuel and set it on fire..
item.dc:creator: @maryannehobbs
item.description:
#27 the Firefly on Hollywood & Vine.. beloved of bikers, hustlers, dealers, the odd actor & thrash metal band.. i'd take a seat at the bar and play dice with the night..
a narrow steel trough ran around bar's edge and at midnight, they’d fill with fuel and set it on fire..
